comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: We are looking to pinpont the location of this building. Anyone from Rocky who might be able to help us?

comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: Denham and East, looking SE.  The corner block is now a very ugly bank, but the last bay (darker part on the right) is still there.  Street to the left now a pedestrian zone of drab newer buildings with some sort of ridiculous giant umbrella.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sethgaines] Thanks Seth - there's nothing like a bit of local knowledge! Or cleverness with comparing old and contemporary photos. Many thanks.

comment._content: Love the Architecture of the main building, classic!

comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: Although I'd love to visit Australia some day, I've never been.  I just played around on Google street view.

comment.author: 47013386@N06
comment._content: I was there.  It was stinking hot. The poor Queen must have just about broiled in an open car.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47013386@N06]  How wonderful to have had that experience. So many of the photographs of that time show people dressed in what seems to be very warm clothing considering our climate! It would be great to hear any more memories of that day.
